definition: To protect or guard against an attack or threat, often involving the use of force or strategy. It is commonly employed in the context of safeguarding oneself, others, or one's beliefs, principles, rights, or possessions from harm or intrusion.

examples.german: Der Anwalt wird den Angeklagten verteidigen.
examples.english: The lawyer will defend the defendant.

examples.german: Er konnte seinen Titel erfolgreich verteidigen.
examples.english: He was able to successfully defend his title.

examples.german: Die Mannschaft muss den Vorsprung verteidigen.
examples.english: The team has to defend the lead.
